metadata.title: CVE-2019-8322 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in RubyGems 2.6 and later through 3.0.2. The gemowner command outputs the contents of the API response directly to stdout.Therefore, if the response is crafted, escape sequence injection may occur.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8322` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.14
libtcltk-ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.14
ri1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.14
ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.14
ruby1.9.1-examples - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.14
ruby1.9.1-full - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.14
ruby1.9.3 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.14
No subscription required

libruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.13
ruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.13
ruby2.0-tcltk - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.13
No subscription required

jruby - 1.5.6-9+deb8u2build0.14.04.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ruby1.9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.14').
ruby2.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.13').
jruby package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.6-9+deb8u2build0.14.04.1~esm2').
